summary: This bill, the "Bill to Outlaw Wounding of Official Working Animals Act" (BOWOW Act), amends the Immigration and Nationality Act. It makes aliens inadmissible to the United States or deportable if they have been convicted of, admit to committing, or admit to committing acts that constitute the essential elements of an offense under 18 U.S.C. §1368, which relates to harming animals used in law enforcement. The bill aims to protect working animals.
